name: China: The Ming Dynasty Online Trivia | Asian | 10 Questions

questions.text: The Ming dynasty reigned during which period of time?
questions.explanation:
1368-1644 A.D.

	1644-1911 was the time of the Qing (Manchu) dynasty. 2200-1766 B.C. was the time of the Xia dynasty, which was the earliest Chinese dynasty. 202 B.C. - A.D. 9 were the years of the Early Han dynasty.

questions.text: Who was the first Ming emperor?
questions.explanation:
Hong Wu.

	After a thirteen-year campaign, Hong Wu (born Zhu Yuan Zhang, also known as Chu Yuan-chang) captured Beijing from the Mongols and drove them out of China, ending the Yuan dynasty. Hong Wu became the ruler of China in 1368, and ruled for thirty years. His name means "warlike". Before he became the emperor of China, he was a Buddhist monk, but joined a rebellion in order to overthrow the Mongols.

questions.text: The grandson of the first Ming emperor ruled only four years before he was overthrown by his uncle, Zhu Di. What was this grandson's name?
questions.explanation:
Zhu Yunwen.

	Zhu Yunwen chose the name Jianwen (as his reign title), and strengthened China by fortifying its capital. The economy greatly flourished during Jianwen's reign.

questions.text: It what year did Emperor Zhu Di change his name to Yongle, or Yung Lo?
questions.explanation:
1403.

	Yongle, although he was a usurper, helped China to become a very great and prosperous country, and ruled from 1402-1424. In 1421 he moved the Chinese capital from Nanjing to Beijing.

questions.text: Yung Lo set up some of the first Chinese colleges during his reign.
questions.explanation:
True.

	These colleges were for training mandarins, or civil servants. Yung Lo also wrote, with the help of others, an encyclopedia, which included entries on history, philosophy, and other subjects.

questions.text: China was affected by the Black Death during the early part of the Ming dynasty.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The Black Death, or Black Plague, swept across China in 1353-1354, about fifteen years before Zhu Yuan Zhang founded the Ming dynasty in 1368.

questions.text: In what year did the first Portugese traders arrive in China?
questions.explanation:
1517.

	Portugese traders conducted their business mainly in the port of Guangzhou.

questions.text: Where did Emperor Yongle build the Forbidden City?
questions.explanation:
Beijing.

	Although the capital of China was Nanjing at the time of the building, Yongle chose to build his city in Beijing. It was "forbidden" because only the emperor and his family were allowed to use it.

questions.text: Who painted the classic Ming painting, "Dreaming of Immortality in a Thatched Cottage"?
questions.explanation:
Tang Yin.

	Li Cheng was a famous artist during the Song dynasty, and Wuwei and Wu Di can be traced back to the Han dynasty. Landscape artwork, as well as ceramics, was very popular during the Ming dynasty. Literature also grew in popularity during the Ming Dynasty, and four famous novels were written. These were "The Romance of the Three Kingdoms", "The Water Margin (All Men Are Brothers)", "Journey to the West", and "The Golden Lotus".

questions.text: What brought on the decline and eventual fall of the Ming dynasty?
options: The invasion of Korea by the Japanese
The capture of most of China by rebels
questions.explanation:
All of these.

	Heavy taxation and incompetent government by some of the later Ming emperors provoked revolts from peasants. The Ming dynasty was followed by the Qing (Manchu) dynasty. Thank you for playing my quiz. If you have some comments or suggestions, I would love to hear from you.
